intro: Secamone varia, commonly known as the variable secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, fragrant, white or yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its dispersal in natural habitats.
